channel.title: Level, Strength and Range?
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Level, Strength and Range?"

item.title: Re: Level, Strength and Range?
item.content:encoded:
i did a lot of reasearch into this, and my results are on this page:

http://bvs.wikidot.com/forum/t-87532/burger-ninja

item.title: Re: Level, Strength and Range?
item.content:encoded:
I'd say levels are more important right away than strength or range. You can eat 3 burgers for each nugget (not counting sodas), so they're a little more effective appetite wise. I used ~5 burgers, and ~1 nugget per day when I was finishing BurgerNinja.

I'd also highly, highly suggest you get Cici before worrying about the other allies too much. The +2 levels helps a lot.

Also, yes, like the other person said, go crank 0 in BurgerNinga. It's already hard enough as it is, lol, and a single crank level really won't affect your find rate all that much.

Also, if you aren't already a Jonin, become a Jonin first. It does increase your Dou range to 12 when you become Jonin.

item.title: Re: Level, Strength and Range?
item.content:encoded: I used 4 Greassy Nuggets; and that's the max I can get.

item.title: Re: Level, Strength and Range?
item.content:encoded: Well, I'd turn the crank down to 0 first, since at level 5 all your rolls have to be successes without Cici/gressy burgers. As for strength vs. range, I'd increase your range a little since it needs less appetite, but otherwise I'd focus mostly on increaseing strength.

item.title: Re: Level, Strength and Range?
item.content:encoded: I forgot to add that without any allies I am level 5 in Doujutsu.

item.title: Level, Strength and Range?
item.content:encoded: I'm trying for the burger-ninja allies and have my crank up 1 difficulty. I have stuffed myself with Greassy Nuggets like the Guide said (4 to be exact) and didn't even come close. Also, according to the calculator, Level helps more than Range and Strength, but I want to know which is actually better: Range, Strength, or Level?
